intro: Solidago speciosa var. erecta, commonly known as showy goldenrod, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in late summer and early autumn, which are arranged in panicles. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. This variety is often found in moist to dry meadows, woodlands, and disturbed sites.
